entry.title: Teaching & Research Coding CDI at EM Lyon Business School
entry.summary: Seeking strong teachers to build and deliver programming and data analysis curriculum for non-engineers.
entry.content:
EM-Lyon is building new courses in introductory programming and data analytics.  We need talented teachers who are motivated and skilled at teaching non-engineers to code.  We also need research coding support.  We are hiring for multiple positions at multiple levels.  If you know how to teach Python, and have some data analytics experience (e.g. advanced Excel, SQL, possibly Tableau or Qlik and pandas), you would be a great fit for us.  If you have some of this but not all of it, but are talented at teaching and organizing, get in touch!  More advanced data analysis skills like machine learning, neural nets, and data visualization would also be very welcome.

For one version of the job ad, see the Data R&D Institute post here.  A full portfolio including teaching references is not needed for first conversations with us. 

Please contact Lynn Cherny, cherny@em-lyon.com, for more info and to start a chat with us.
